sub_title: Solution Architect at European Medicines Agency
summary:
Seasoned and experienced IT executive with 15+ years of industry experience in the field of solution architecture, software hardware integration, project management and client engagement management. Sandeep has worked on solution architecture for multiple reputed clients from Airline, RFID, Retail, Telecommunications and homeland security domain. He is a groomed leader who believes in leading from front by example and delight for customer. Born with appetite for challenge and growth, has strong exposure to business development globally and end-to-end system integration projects – blended with strong technical and communication skills makes him highly useful resource for the organizations.

Recent role and technologies worked on –

-	Business Development, Sales and Pre Sale exposure of over 12+ years.
-	Business Process Management, RFID and AIT Solutions.
-	Cloud and Rapid Application Development based System Architectures.
-	Hardware Integration with systems including Retail PoS, RFID scanners, etc.
-	Enterprise System Architecture including asynchronous messaging, J2EE, C++.
-	Program, Project and People management skills.
-	Agile and Waterfall method executions.

projects.title: Detecting Duplicate entries using Multi modal Biometric Matching
projects.description:
Uniqueness of resident database is of utmost importance for providing effective and corruption free e-Governance services to all citizens. Relying on the credentials provided for the registration is not a fool proof way for detecting duplicate entries. World renowned UIDAI program and one of the largest biometrics based resident enrollment bases de-duplication of records using multi modal 1:N biometric matching – which involves image-to-image matching of 10 fingerprints, 2 Iris scans and face recognition algorithms. Every record is matched against an existing gallery of 700 million records (enrollment count by September 2014) with permissible error rate below 1%.

I lead the solution team during the pre-sales solution and successfully implemented the PoC. The biometrics teams were based in Norway for Fingerprints, United states for Iris scans and German team for face recognition. The solution was intended to be deployed on 370 servers in production with 100% DR capacity. The challenge for the solution was to handle high volume of transactions – over 1.25 million per day at peak and work in multi-server environment which was achieved using the system.

contributors.headline: Solution Architect at European Medicines Agency

projects.title: Early Warning System for Hydro Power Projects
projects.description:
Quantity and Quality of water flowing into the hydro power dam is critical to the operations of the hydro power project. The current process for the measurement involves manual testing at regular intervals. However, tough and remote terrains combined with climate conditions makes the process unreliable and error prone. Errors or delay in action could result in damages to equipment, structure or damage to life and property downstream.

Sensor based systems deploy appropriate sensors which stream the data through appropriate connectivity to the control room in real time. This permits the system to generate different types of warnings in real time for officers and suggest necessary action. The system also aids in dissemination of information using public address system to population downstream.

My role of the system was solution designer migrating the solution from Japan and lead the pre-sales efforts for opportunities in US, Latin America and India. I was also responsible to integrate the solution with partner hardware interface for hydro sensors and consultation to the customer with hydro analysis of the river terrains in India.

contributors.headline: Solution Architect at European Medicines Agency

projects.title: RFID Based Aircraft Inventory and Maintenance
projects.description:
Aircrafts are flying machines and are maintained at different locations by different teams. However, maintenance history for the parts, which is critical to effective maintenance, is not shared between the different teams - making the operations costly and time consuming.

RFID based inventory management and maintenance solution is designed to carry the information about the maintenance history on the part electronically. This aids the maintenance teams at remote locations to quickly locate the part from complex assembly and also effectively perform maintenance operations.

I lead the project team for implementation of the project spread across 4 phases. I was also core part of the architecture team and overlooked the system design. I was also responsible for client interaction for acceptance with Fujitsu and Boeing.
